page.title: 05WEATHER AND CLIMATE
page.content: THE AREA OF THE BLOCK IS SUBJECT TO THE CLIMATIC ADVANTAGES AND DISADVANTAGES OF A COASTAL LOCATION. COMPARED TO INLAND, AND HIGHER LOCATIONS,SUCH AS THE KEITH AREA,BUCKIE IS NOT NORMALY SUBJECT TO LONG SPELLS WITH LYING SNOW.AGAIN,THE COASTAL LOCATION GREATLY REDUCES THE NUMBER OF FROSTY DAYS.HOWEVER THE BLOCK IS VERY EXPOSED TO WINDS WITH A NORTHERLY COMPONENT WHICH SWEEP IN OVER THE MORAY FIRTH.IN WINTER THESE WINDS OFTEN BRING SNOW, SLEET AND RAIN. WHILE IN SPRING AND SUMMER THEY RESULT IN VERY CHILLY CONDITIONS AND THEY DAMAGE BLOSSOM,AND LEAVES AND MAKE LIFE DIFFICULT FOR GARDENERS. CONT._
